nextJobs.name: Downtime gap auto-fill guard (quiet unless triggered)
Control room issue triage + QA intake

findings: Durable improvement direction: keep runtime truth (`IDLE`/`RUNNING`) distinct from schedule truth (planned current block), and consider explicit labeling in UI to avoid confusion.

Issue #1 shipped as `v1.3.2` (`refs #1`): Next-lane now dedupes overlapping timeline/status entries with time-range + semantic/token overlap; regression test added for exact 17:00 usage-report overlap case; issue #1 closed.
Preference update: Sean wants shorter, high-signal summaries by default in chat updates.

Shipped control-room UX/branding overhaul as `v1.4.0` with one commit per ticket (#5-#9): tactile refresh interactions, mobile-first touch layout, OpenClaw coral/cyan theme alignment, custom lobster favicon + home-screen icons, and final accessibility/interaction polish. All related issues were opened first and then closed after release verification.
UX preference update from Sean: home-screen icon must be full-bleed and clearly recognizable; theme should prioritize OpenClaw warm coral/orange gradients over cyan-forward accents.
Dashboard runtime preference clarified: Runtime Status should indicate background work only (cron/subagent/autonomous tasks), not foreground chat activity in the main session.

jobSuccessTrend.job: Control room issue triage + QA intake
Downtime gap auto-fill guard (quiet unless triggered)

activity.text: Released `v1.1.0` with tag + GitHub release: https://github.com/SeanKudrna/claw-control-room/releases/tag/v1.1.0
Sean set explicit directive: control-room is a continuously improving product lane owned by Claw (UI/UX/usability/functionality/transparency), with autonomous roadmap management.
Added recurring cron governance job: `Control room issue triage + QA intake` (09:35/13:35/17:35/21:35 CT) for issue monitoring + QA ticket intake.
Added GitHub issue templates for QA bugs and product improvements.
Opened initial QA backlog tickets from live review:
#1 [QA] Deduplicate overlapping entries in Overview Next lane
#2 [UX] Remove duplicate heading stacks inside collapsible panels
Added issue snapshot tooling (`scripts/issue_snapshot.py`) + tests and documented ticket-linked commit rule (`refs #<issue>`).
Added deterministic runtime monitor to control-room UI showing `IDLE` vs `RUNNING`, active job list, and live elapsed timers.
Runtime detection source: session-store run keys reconciled against cron finished-run logs for definitive active-run detection.
Shipped as ticket-linked release `v1.3.0` with commit message including `refs #3` and GitHub release tag.
Added control-room data freshness indicator in header (`Fresh`, `Aging`, `Stale`) computed from payload `generatedAt`.
Why: prevents accidental trust in stale dashboard snapshots when gist refresh lags.
Updated React hook + header UI + styles + README docs.
Proof: `./scripts/quality_gate.sh` passed (Python tests + TS typecheck + Vite build).

Runtime misalignment fix shipped as `v1.3.1` (`refs #4`): excluded control-room status publisher self-run from runtime detection and increased status publish cadence to 1-minute for fresher idle/running state.
Sean reported the dashboard still looked wrong for idle/running state; live verification after `v1.3.1` showed Runtime Status correctly at `IDLE` with no active background runs.
New UX clarity gap identified: `Now` lane can still show a scheduled time block (from planning docs) while runtime is `IDLE`, which can feel contradictory to users.
Durable improvement direction: keep runtime truth (`IDLE`/`RUNNING`) distinct from schedule truth (planned current block), and consider explicit labeling in UI to avoid confusion.

Issue #1 shipped as `v1.3.2` (`refs #1`): Next-lane now dedupes overlapping timeline/status entries with time-range + semantic/token overlap; regression test added for exact 17:00 usage-report overlap case; issue #1 closed.
Preference update: Sean wants shorter, high-signal summaries by default in chat updates.

Shipped control-room UX/branding overhaul as `v1.4.0` with one commit per ticket (#5-#9): tactile refresh interactions, mobile-first touch layout, OpenClaw coral/cyan theme alignment, custom lobster favicon + home-screen icons, and final accessibility/interaction polish. All related issues were opened first and then closed after release verification.
UX preference update from Sean: home-screen icon must be full-bleed and clearly recognizable; theme should prioritize OpenClaw warm coral/orange gradients over cyan-forward accents.
Dashboard runtime preference clarified: Runtime Status should indicate background work only (cron/subagent/autonomous tasks), not foreground chat activity in the main session.
